comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: William V. Cleary, for the last fourteen years Town Clerk of Haverstraw, shot and instantly killed, in his office in the Town Hall here this afternoon, Eugene M. Newman, 18 years old, of this place, who secretly married Mr. Cleary's 17-year-old daughter Anna last Saturday. Source: select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F00A1FF6345D1373...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Newman was killed by his unwilling father-in-law in Haverstraw, New York, twenty miles from NYC, on July 23, 1914.

comment.author: 37149688@N08
comment._content: One more tragedy which didn't stop with Mr. Cleary's death. How sad. And what was Mr. Newman's fate? Capital punishment probably.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Alas! Mr. Newman was the murder victim. Let's pay attention.

comment.author: 60041962@N02
comment._content: Well, now I'm curious.  What became of murder Mr. William V. Cleary?

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Check out the link to the nytimes article in Richard Arthur Norton's post, chicadee3. Also the wikipedia article about the murder gives some clues as to what became of Mr. Cleary after the jury acquitted him of murder, en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cleary-Newman_murder

comment.author: 80397896@N03
comment._content: I wrote the Wikipedia article. Eugene Newman was my great-uncle (father's father's brother). I and my father were both named after him, but I knew nothing of him or his murder until I was almost 40 years old and had moved to Chicago. The whole thing was a secret that nobody in my family, or in the town of Haverstraw, ever spoke about.
